016package edu.cnm.deepdive.teamle.service;
017
018import android.annotation.SuppressLint;
019import android.content.Context;
020import android.content.Intent;
021import android.content.res.Resources;
022import androidx.activity.result.ActivityResult;
023import androidx.activity.result.ActivityResultLauncher;
024import androidx.annotation.NonNull;
025import com.google.android.gms.auth.api.signin.GoogleSignIn;
026import com.google.android.gms.auth.api.signin.GoogleSignInAccount;
027import com.google.android.gms.auth.api.signin.GoogleSignInClient;
028import com.google.android.gms.auth.api.signin.GoogleSignInOptions;
029import com.google.android.gms.common.api.ApiException;
030import com.google.android.gms.tasks.Task;
031import dagger.hilt.android.qualifiers.ApplicationContext;
032import io.reactivex.rxjava3.core.Completable;
033import io.reactivex.rxjava3.core.Single;
034import io.reactivex.rxjava3.core.SingleEmitter;
035import io.reactivex.rxjava3.schedulers.Schedulers;
036import javax.inject.Inject;
037import javax.inject.Singleton;
038
039/**
040 * Provides ReactiveX-integrated Google Sign In client flows for signing in, refreshing the bearer
041 * token, and signing out. This class is implemented as a singleton, and the implementation is
042 * thread-safe; however to minimize the risk of concurrency issues in the underlying Google Sign In
043 * client library, this class should be consumed by a single viewmodel (e.g.
044 * {@link edu.cnm.deepdive.teamle.viewmodel.LoginViewModel}).
045 */
046@SuppressWarnings("unused")
047@Singleton
048public class GoogleSignInService {
049
050  private static final String BEARER_TOKEN_FORMAT = "Bearer %s";
051
052  private final GoogleSignInClient client;
053
054  @Inject
055  GoogleSignInService(@ApplicationContext Context context) {
056    Resources res = context.getResources();
057    @SuppressLint("DiscouragedApi")
058    int identifier = res.getIdentifier("client_id", "string", context.getPackageName());
059    String clientId = (identifier != 0) ? res.getString(identifier) : null;
060    GoogleSignInOptions.Builder builder = new GoogleSignInOptions.Builder()
061        .requestEmail()
062        .requestId()
063        .requestProfile();
064    if (clientId != null && !clientId.isEmpty()) {
065      builder.requestIdToken(clientId);
066    }
067    client = GoogleSignIn.getClient(context, builder.build());
068  }
069
070  /**
071   * Constructs and returns a {@link Single Single&lt;GoogleSignInAccount&gt;} that, when executed
072   * (subscribed to) refreshes the Google Sign In account credentials. This is of most use when a
073   * bearer token is needed to access a web service application; however, in most cases, the
074   * {@link #refreshBearerToken()} method is more convenient for that purpose.
075   *
076   * @return {@link Single Single&lt;GoogleSignInAccount&gt;} configured for downstream execution in
077   * a thread pool managed by the {@link Schedulers#io()} scheduler.
078   */
079  public Single<GoogleSignInAccount> refresh() {
080    return Single
081        .create((SingleEmitter<GoogleSignInAccount> emitter) ->
082            client
083                .silentSignIn()
084                .addOnSuccessListener(emitter::onSuccess)
085                .addOnFailureListener(emitter::onError)
086        )
087        .observeOn(Schedulers.io());
088  }
089
090  /**
091   * Constructs and returns a {@link Single Single&lt;String&gt;} that, when executed (subscribed
092   * to) refreshes the Google Sign In account credentials and bearer token. This is primarily of use
093   * when such a bearer token is needed to access a web service application. In fact, the result
094   * delivered to the subscribed
095   * {@link io.reactivex.rxjava3.functions.Consumer Consumer&lt;String&gt;} is suitable for use as
096   * the value of the {@code Authorization} header of an HTTP request.
097   *
098   * @return {@link Single Single&lt;String&gt;} configured for downstream execution in a thread
099   * pool managed by the {@link Schedulers#io()} scheduler.
100   */
101  public Single<String> refreshBearerToken() {
102    return refresh()
103        .map(this::getBearerToken);
104  }
105
106  /**
107   * Sets the Google Sign In process flow in motion, using the specified
108   * {@link ActivityResultLauncher ActivityResultLauncher&lt;Intent&gt;} as a callback.
109   *
110   * @param launcher Callback provided (indirectly) by the requesting {@link android.app.Activity}.
111   */
112  public void startSignIn(ActivityResultLauncher<Intent> launcher) {
113    launcher.launch(client.getSignInIntent());
114  }
115
116  /**
117   * Constructs and returns a {@link Single Single&lt;GoogleSignInAccount&gt;} that, when executed
118   * (subscribed to), completes the Google Sign In process flow. If sign-in is successful, the
119   * active {@link GoogleSignInAccount} is extracted from the provided {@link ActivityResult} and
120   * delivered to the downstream
121   * {@link io.reactivex.rxjava3.functions.Consumer Consumer&lt;GoogleSignInAccount&gt;}
122   *
123   * @param result {@link ActivityResult} passed to the
124   *               {@link ActivityResultLauncher ActivityResultLauncher&lt;Intent&gt;} specified in
125   *               the invocation of {@link #startSignIn(ActivityResultLauncher)}.
126   * @return {@link Single Single&lt;GoogleSignInAccount&gt;} configured for downstream execution in
127   * a thread pool managed by the {@link Schedulers#io()} scheduler.
128   */
129  public Single<GoogleSignInAccount> completeSignIn(ActivityResult result) {
130    return Single
131        .create((SingleEmitter<GoogleSignInAccount> emitter) -> {
132          try {
133            Task<GoogleSignInAccount> task =
134                GoogleSignIn.getSignedInAccountFromIntent(result.getData());
135            GoogleSignInAccount account = task.getResult(ApiException.class);
136            emitter.onSuccess(account);
137          } catch (ApiException e) {
138            emitter.onError(e);
139          }
140        })
141        .observeOn(Schedulers.io());
142  }
143
144  /**
145   * Constructs and returns a {@link Completable} that, when executed (subscribed to), signs the
146   * current Google Sign In user from this app.
147   *
148   * @return {@link Completable} configured for downstream execution in a thread pool managed by the
149   * {@link Schedulers#io()} scheduler.
150   */
151  public Completable signOut() {
152    return Completable
153        .create((emitter) ->
154            client
155                .signOut()
156                .addOnSuccessListener((ignored) -> emitter.onComplete())
157                .addOnFailureListener(emitter::onError)
158        )
159        .subscribeOn(Schedulers.io());
160  }
161
162  @NonNull
163  private String getBearerToken(GoogleSignInAccount account) {
164    return String.format(BEARER_TOKEN_FORMAT, account.getIdToken());
165  }
166
167}
